titleInfo.title: Letter to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from John Beaumont and George Green at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter discusses at length a legal dispute involving Robert Garden and George Kinnear. Sales of woolens and other finanical matters are discussed in detail. The letter reports that Carim Cahn [Karim Khan] refused to accept the presents for him from the Bussora [Basra] delgation that travelled to Schiras [Shiraz], telling them that he insisted upon the possession of Bussora.The letter reports that through Shaikh Sadoon an agreement has been made with Carim Cahn that he shall purchase three or four lachs of rupees of cloth and perpets per annum. The letter also includes details of Beaumont and Green's expenses that were sustained during their captivity and in trying to procure their liberty. The letter states that monthly accounts for May, June and July are enclosed (they are not contained in the file).
